title: Eloquent JavaScript
description: This is a book about JavaScript, programming, and the wonders of the digital.
author: Marijn Haverbeke

title: You Dont Know JS (Book Series)
description: This concise yet in-depth guide takes you inside scope and closures, two core concepts you need to know to become a more efficient and effective JavaScript programmer.
author: Kyle Simpson

title: JavaScript For Cats
description: An in-browser interactive introductory programming text designed for cats. Humans are probably also capable of following along.
author: Max Ogden

title: jQuery: Novice to Ninja: New Kicks And Tricks
description: This concise yet in-depth guide takes you inside scope and closures, two core concepts you need to know to become a more efficient and effective JavaScript programmer.
author: Earle Castledine & Craig Sharkie

title: Javascript Enlightenment
description: If you are a designer or developer who has only used JavaScript under the mantle of libraries (such as jQuery, Prototype, etc), it is my hope that the material in this book will transform you from a JavaScript library user into a JavaScript developer.
author: Cody Lindley

title: Building A JavaScript Framework
description: This book is a guide to building a JavaScript framework. It’ll teach you how to build a framework and draw on real-world code from projects like jQuery.
author: Alex Young

title: Node Beginner
description: The aim of this document is to get you started with developing applications with Node.js, teaching you everything you need to know about 'advanced' JavaScript along the way.
author: Manuel Kiessling

title: jQuery Fundamentals
description: jQuery Fundamentals is designed to get you comfortable working through common problems you'll be called upon to solve using jQuery.
author: Rebecca Murphey

title: Learning Javascript Design Patterns
description: In this book we will explore applying both classical and modern design patterns to the JavaScript programming language.
author: Addy Osmaniy

title: Developing Backbone.js Applications
description: If you want to build your site’s frontend with the single-page application (SPA) model, this hands-on book shows you how to get the job done with Backbone.js.
author: Addy Osmaniy

title: Javascript Guide
description: If you are new to JavaScript, this guide will walk you through the language.
author: Mozilla Developer Network

title: The little Book on CoffeeScript
description: This book is designed to help you learn CoffeeScript, understand best practices and start building awesome client side applications.
author: Alex MacCaw

title: Mixu's Node book
description: A comprehensive and interesting NodeJS overview covering many aspects in details.
author: Mikito Takada

title: Up and Running with Node.js
description: Discover NodeJS APIS, tools, modules and best practices and learn how to extend it.
author: Tom Hughes-Croucher

title: Mastering NodeJS
description: In Mastering Node we will discover how to write high concurrency web servers
author: TJ Holowaychuk

title: Stream handbook
description: a free short e-book that teaches you how to write node programs with streams, by James Halliday a famous NodeJS supporter that published numerous awesome NodeJS modules
author: James Halliday (substack)

title: Art of Node
description: a free short e-book that teaches you the fundamentals of Node.js by Max Odgen, a popular Node supporter
author: Max Odgen

title: Recipes with Angular.js
description: Practical concepts and techniques for rapid web application development
author: Frederik Dietz

title: Angular Succinctly
description: Whether you are a novice looking to understand Angular.js or an expert seeking a reference guide, AngularJS Succinctly is indispensable!
author: Frederik Dietz

title: AngularJS Directives in Traction
description: This eBook helps you understand how built-in directives work and teaches you to build custom directives on your own.
author: Amit Gharat

title: AngularJS Fundamentals in 60 minutes
description: This eBook is a documented transcription of the famous 'AngularJS in 60 minutes' video; The ebook is going through all of the key fundamentals you need to know about the AngularJS SPA framework.
author: Dan Wahlin

title: Knockout.js Succinctly
description: Knockout.js Succinctly is intended for professional web developers who need to build dynamic, scalable user interfaces with minimal code. Author Ryan Hodson guides you through the essentials of the library, starting with a brief overview of Knockout and its data-oriented aspects, followed by a thorough examination of binding data to various HTML elements, and finally examples of accessing external data and combining Knockout with jQuery animation routines.
author: Ryan Hodson

title: Smooth CoffeeScript
description: An introduction to CoffeeScript programming with an emphasis on clarity, abstraction and verification.
author: E. Hoigaard

title: Hard Rock CoffeeScript
description: CoffeeScript programming language guide with javascript design patterns explained in coffeescript.
author: Alex Chaplinsky

title: Testing with CoffeeScript
description: You will be guided through the creation of a shopping cart system. You’ll learn about using and testing jQuery code, writing more idiomatic CoffeeScript and building a well thought out and structured, complex JavaScript application.
author: Jack Franklin

title: CoffeeScript Cookbook
description: CoffeeScript recipes for the community by the community.
author: Multiple Owner

title: JavaScript Garden
description: JavaScript Garden is a growing collection of documentation about the most quirky parts of the JavaScript programming language. It gives advice to avoid common mistakes and subtle bugs, as well as performance issues and bad practices, that non-expert JavaScript programmers may encounter on their endeavours into the depths of the language.
author: Ivo Wetzel & Zhang Yi Jiang

title: Sams Teach Yourself JavaScript in 24 Hours
description: JavaScript is one of the easiest, most straightforward ways to enhance a Web site with interactivity. Sams Teach Yourself JavaScript in 24 Hours serves as an easy-to-understand tutorial on both scripting basics and JavaScript itself. The book is written in a clear and personable style with an extensive use of practical, complete examples.
author: Michael Moncur

title: jQuery, jQuery UI, and jQuery Mobile: Recipes and Examples
description: jQuery makes it easier than ever for developers to build exceptionally robust, cross-platform websites and mobile apps. This extremely useful guide brings together more than one hundred self-contained, downloadable examples, each with an in-depth explanation of how the code works and how to adapt it for your own needs.
author: Adriaan de Jonge & Phillip Dutson

title: Node.js The Right Way
description: This short book packs a hefty dose of Node.js. You’ll test your code’s functionality and performance under load. You’ll learn important aspects of Node development—from its architecture and core, to its ecosystem of third-party modules.
author: Jim R. Wilson

title: Head First jQuery (Brain-Friendly Guides)
description: If you want to learn—and understand—how to create interactive web pages, unobtrusive script, and cool animations that don't kill your browser, this book is for you.
author: Ryan Benedetti & Ronan Cranley

title: jQuery Cookbook
description: Getting started with the jQuery library is easy, but it can take years to fully realize its breadth and depth; jQuery Cookbook shortens the learning curve considerably. The recipes start with the basics and then move into practical use cases with tested solutions to common web development hurdles.
author: Cody Lindley

title: Building Backbone Plugins
description: From the creator of MarionetteJS - the premiere application framework for Backbone.js - comes a book that will show you how to Eliminate the boilerplate code that plagues your Backbone apps by building the add-ons and abstractions that your app needs.
author: Derick Bailey & Jerome Gravel-Niquet

title: Effecive Javascript: 68 Specific Ways to Harness the Power of JavaScript
description: Reflecting the latest versions of the JavaScript standard, the book offers well-proven techniques and best practices you’ll rely on for years to come.
author: David Herman

title: Maintainable JavaScript
description: Author Nicholas Zakas assembled this collection of best practices as a front-end tech leader at Yahoo!, after completing his own journey from solo hacker to team player. He also includes rules recommended by other industry authorities. Use these tips and techniques to help your team set aside individual preferences and function at a higher level.
author: Nicholas C. Zakas

title: SurviveJS - Webpack and React
description: Webpack, a module bundler, solves a significant problem for web developers. It can be daunting to learn but once you grok it, life gets easier. Same goes for React, a JavaScript library for building UIs. This book shows you how to build a little Kanban application using these technologies. During the process you will learn the basics and will be able to take the skills to your own projects.
author: Juho Vepsäläinen

title: React: Up & Running
description: Building Web Applications
author: Stoyan Stefanov

title: AngularJS: Up and Running
description: If you want to get started with AngularJS, either as a side project, an additional tool, or for your main work, this practical guide teaches you how to use this meta-framework step-by-step, from the basics to advanced concepts. By the end of the book, you’ll understand how to develop a large, maintainable, and performant application with AngularJS.
author: Shyam Seshadri, Brad Green

title: Pro Angularjs
description: AngularJS is the leading framework for building dynamic JavaScript applications that take advantage of the capabilities of modern browsers and devices. AngularJS, which is maintained by Google, brings the power of the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern to the client, providing the foundation for complex and rich web apps. It allows you to build applications that are smaller, faster, and with a lighter resource footprint than ever before.
author: Adam Freeman

title: Web Development with Node and Express
description: AngularJS is the leading framework for building dynamic JavaScript applications that take advantage of the capabilities of modern browsers and devices. AngularJS, which is maintained by Google, brings the power of the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern to the client, providing the foundation for complex and rich web apps. It allows you to build applications that are smaller, faster, and with a lighter resource footprint than ever before.
author: Ethan Brown

title: JavaScript Patterns
description: Learn how to build dynamic web applications with Express, a key component of the Node/JavaScript development stack. In this hands-on guide, author Ethan Brown teaches you the fundamentals through the development of a fictional application that exposes a public website and a RESTful API. You’ll also learn web architecture best...
author: Stoyan Stefanov

title: JavaScript with Promises
description: Learn how to build dynamic web applications with Express, a key component of the Node/JavaScript development stack. In this hands-on guide, author Ethan Brown teaches you the fundamentals through the development of a fictional application that exposes a public website and a RESTful API. You’ll also learn web architecture best...
author: Daniel Parker

title: Understanding ECMAScript 6
description: ECMAScript 6 is coming, are you ready? There's a lot of new concepts to learn and understand. Get a headstart with this book!
author: Nicholas C. Zakas

title: Exploring ES6
description: An in-depth book on ECMAScript 6, for JavaScript programmers.
author: Aaron Frost

title: You Don't Know JS: ES6 & Beyond
description: You Don't Know JS: ES6 & Beyond
author: Kyle Simpson

title: Expert JavaScript
description: Expert JavaScript is your definitive guide to understanding how and why JavaScript behaves in the way it does. Master every aspect of this powerful language, apply it pragmatically to your applications - become an expert programmer today.
author: Mark E. Daggett
